climbs.name: Wave Goodbye to the Omicron Wave

content.description: Someone must have done this on TR, just to the right of MRE. Whether you could place gear, I'm unsure. But the movement is totally worth another fun cruiser.
content.location: The other side (to the right) of the MRE crack.

content.description: Starts out tricky with few feet then immediately eases off to some gritty slab moves. The initial difficulty protects well.
content.location: This climb is on the east side of Mars Rock, the dome seen on the east (left) as you approach Moon Rock from the highway. This is the second from left route. Look for the giant pocket on the left side of the crag.

content.description: MRE starts with a hard pull into the crack followed by shallow stemming and pulling on pockets. The crack steepens and narrows down at the top then pulls over to the chains.
content.protection: A single set of cams with an extra or two in the smaller sizes if you want to sew it up. Shares chain anchors with The Exterminator.
content.location: This climb is on the east side of Mars Rock, the dome seen on the east (left) as you approach Moon Rock from the highway. The route is on the far right side of the wall starting in a right facing crack just a couple feet from The Exterminator.

content.description: A thin, shallow seam is the start of this route. Slabby feet and insecure tips jams make it a stout 5.8. Watch out for exfoliating holds. It opens up into a handcrack for the upper part of the route.
content.protection: Has a single piton on the bottom part of the route. The start requires some small pro. I stuffed a 0 C3 in the initial crack and wished I had some small offset cams. As soon as the crack opens up it will take all sizes of gear up to a #2 camalot. Chain anchors on the top shared with MRE.
content.location: Look for the piton in the flaring crack at the bottom of the route.

climbs.name: Alpenheimer's
climbs.fa: Jake Wayman and James Garrett, May 2009

content.description: Smear your way up into the large groove and use thin edges and pockets to get over the steep section. Once past the second bolt the route eases off and is mild to the chains.
content.protection: Quickdraws for about 5 bolts. Chain anchors at the top.
content.location: Farthest left bolted route on the wall.
